name: auto-commit-msg
description: VS Code extension - generate git commit messages

gitSemanticCommit.commitOptions.markdownDescription: Specifies which [arguments](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-commit#_options) to be passed when the commit is executed.

gitSemanticCommit.preserveScope.markdownDescription: Determines whether to preserve the last message scope that was inserted.

gitSemanticCommit.scopeTemplate.markdownDescription: Specifies scope template (`$scope` placeholder will be replaced with the passed scope). Check out [this](https://github.com/nitayneeman/vscode-git-semantic-commit#customize-your-scope) example.

gitSemanticCommit.stageAll.markdownDescription: Determines whether to stage all changes before the commit, in case the staging area (index) is empty.

default.description: Development changes related to the build system
Development changes related to the continuous integration and deployment system
Documentation changes related to the project
Production changes related to new backward-compatible abilities or functionality
Production changes related to backward-compatible bug fixes
Production changes related to backward-compatible performance improvements
Development changes related to modifying the codebase
Development changes related to styling the codebase

items.description: Can be either a string, or an object. If an object, use type for the commit type, and description to give a short description for the particular commit type.

gitSemanticCommit.types.markdownDescription: Specifies the supported message types. Check out [this](https://github.com/nitayneeman/vscode-git-semantic-commit#customize-your-types) example.
